values: FDC will assure the deflection and
elevation given by the FO does not exceed range limits.

OIC and RSO will have prior knowledge of left and right limits, maximum and minimum elevations and will verify for each mission/correction. OIC will use safety circle to verify 60mm/81mm properly laid in.
FDC, Section Sergeant, Evaluator, OIC/RSO and Mortar Platoon Leadership will consistently check target grids and data sent to FDC to compute fire missions. SOP #3 is on hand to reference SDZs.
RSO/OIC, FDC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers
Rounds are clearly separated
by type (HE, FRTR, Illum) and size (120mm, 81mm, 60mm). Dunnage is separated. Only
rounds used for the day are broken down. Only one type of round broken down at a time.

Ammo detail under consistent NCO leadership will be committed to running the ammo point. Mortar Leadership will ensure only the correct ammo is being issued and that issue and dunnage return is centralized and controlled.
Ammo Detail, Mortar Leadership,OIC, RSO
All Soldiers will be briefed and
trained on the proper storage, handling and firing of the mortar
rounds.
All Mortar Platoon Leadership, Evaluator, and Range OIC / RSO will ensure mortar rounds are handled with constant care and stored in pre authorized and designated areas.
FDC, Section Sergeant, Platoon Sergeant, Platoon Leader, Evaluator, Range OIC, Range RSO
All soldiers will wear proper protective
equipment on the firing line to mitigate the effects of any blast. The
uniform is either a chicken vest or IOTV (plates in), ACH, ear protection, eye protection, OCPs (full) and knee
pads (no gloves).
NCOs, followed by Mortar Platoon Leadership and RSO will perform PCC and PCIs on soldiers to ensure everyone is in the correct uniform before firing.
Mortar Leadership, OIC/RSO
After all Soldiers move back to a safe distance, the gun crew will
conduct hang fire procedures in
accordance with the applicable Technical Manual.
All Soldiers will announce the hang fire to the gun line.
Mortar hang fire procedures will be briefed and rehearsed prior to start of the live fire.
FDC, Section Sergeant, Platoon Sergeant, Platoon Leader, Evaluator, OIC, RSO
All Soldiers on the firing line will announce the miss fire.
The gun crew will
conduct miss fire procedures in
accordance with the applicable Technical Manual.
Mortar miss fire verbal announcement procedures will be briefed and rehearsed prior to start of the live fire.
FDC, Section Sergeant, Platoon Sergeant, Platoon Leader, Evaluator, OIC, RSO
If the round does not fire, the round will be extracted and placed in the dud pit.

60mm, 81mm, and RMS6L 120mm Stryker Misfire Procedures will have already been trained and tested on during MORTEP Gunners Training. Additional mandatory Misfire training will take place at the start of each day prior the live fire for ALL 11C's on site.
OIC/RSO and section NCO's will enforce movement requirements
All equipment involved in Mortar firing will be serviced prior to the
training cycle and be inspected before each Table and live firing
day.

Squad and Section Leaders ensure their tubes are up to date on pullback test and guns are bore sited. PL inspects TULSA accounts to make sure tubes are up to date and properly annotated. Squad Leaders and operators PMCS according to the TM before and after each event. Aiming Circles declinated within 3 weeks of LFX.
FDC, Section Sergeant, Platoon Sergeant, Platoon Leader, Evaluator, OIC, RSO
Monitor local weather for possible extremes in heat, thunderstorm activity, high winds, etc Avoid
working in open areas when lightning is observed.
MORTEP Planning OIC and Mortar Platoon RTO will consistently monitor the weather and radar. Alibi days have been built into schedule to allow for weather caused make up days.
Platoon Leader, RTO, Range OIC, Range RSO

values: Soldiers wear all assigned PPE, care is taken in unknown areas with rough terrain during execution. Additional caution will be taken when executing night operations. Leaders maintain close control of Soldiers to identify potential hazards.

Briefing, Training, PCC/PCIs
Convoy Commander, OIC/NCOIC, RSO, VCs, Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: COLLISIONS WITH MILITARY OR CIVILIAN MOTOR VEHICLES

values: Mortars will move together in a convoy IOT to maximize control on range roads. Vehicles obey posted speed limits, following distances, and general awareness of civilian and other military traffic. Vehicles each have radios and JBCP and conduct commex.
Convoy Safety Brief, PCC/PCI
Convoy Commander, OIC/NCOIC, RSO, Leaders, Soldiers

values: Soldiers will be given an in-depth safety briefing concerning road safety. Convoy Commander and Leaders will monitor Soldiers and convoy operations. Proper rest plan in place.
Convoy Safety Brief, PCC/PCI
Convoy Commander, OIC/NCOIC, RSO, VCs, Leaders, Soldiers

subtask.name: MOVEMENT TO AND FROM TRAINING AREA

values: Remind soldiers to make sure brakes are set, engine is off, and at least
one wheel is chocked during loading and unloading
Chock blocks and drip pans are required and will be inspected as soon as the MCV sets in position for the gunner. Any additional vehicles must set drip pan and chock block in once arrived on site.
Leadership, Range OIC, Range RSO

draw.overall_supervision_plan: RSO and OIC will orient soldiers to the range and conduct a safety brief each day prior to execution and each evening prior to limited visibility operations. NCOs will safety each other and all Soldiers. Safety will be monitored from Platoon Leader to Soldier and vice versa in order to ensure safe conduct of this LFX.
